findings.title: The reward calculation is unreasonable
findings.description: In the StakeReward contract, because the reward calculation is based on "balance - totalStaking", if no user in the contract receives the reward, then another user can use an unsecured user and keep calling the _withdraw_ function to update accTokenPerShare.

findings.title: The _updatePool function is improperly designed
findings.description: In the __updatePool_ function, if the first user stakes when "block.timestamp - lastReleaseTime > 1 days", the contract will be unavailable, because the totalStaking at this time is zero, and an exception will be thrown when calculating accTokenPerShare.

findings.title: Centralization Risk
findings.description: elephant pool StakingEarn-3 is not fixed and user funds may not be withdrawn.

findings.title: The pendingReward function is improperly designed
findings.description: In the _pendingReward_ function of the StakeReward contract, since the accTokenPerShare is not up to date, the reward queried by the user may be inaccurate.

findings.title: Redundant codes
findings.description: Delete redundant code in StakingEarn contract.

findings.title: Lack of event triggering
findings.description: In the StakingEarn contract, since the _enterStaking_ and _leaveStaking_ functions lack event triggering, it is recommended to trigger the event.

findings.title: Rewards not updated when withdrawing
findings.description: Rewards may not be updated when users withdraw their funds.
